title: How to Install a Sliding Bolt

steps.headline: Gather all the Things You'll Need.
Choose a height for your sliding bolt.
steps.description: Measure and mark it in two places to ensure that the bolt is level.

steps.headline: Align the main body of the bolt with your pencil marks and mark the position of the screw holes.
Drill a shallow hole on each of your screw hole pencil marks.
steps.description: These pilot holes will make it easier to drill in the screws.

steps.headline: Change the drill bit to a screw head bit.
steps.description: Hold the main body of the bolt over your pilot holes and drill into position.

steps.headline: Hold the staple against the door frame, level with the bolt.
steps.description: Draw around it with your pencil. Now you need to chisel out a shallow recess for the bolt holder.

steps.headline: Make a series of deep cuts along your pencil outline.
Check the fit of the bolt holder in the recess.
steps.description: Mark the position of the screw holes.

steps.headline: Attach a narrow bit to the drill and drill some pilot holes, then fit a screw head bit and drill the staple into the recess.

text: Gather all the Things You'll Need.  Choose a height for your sliding bolt. Measure and mark it in two places to ensure that the bolt is level. Align the main body of the bolt with your pencil marks and mark the position of the screw holes.  Drill a shallow hole on each of your screw hole pencil marks. These pilot holes will make it easier to drill in the screws. Change the drill bit to a screw head bit. Hold the main body of the bolt over your pilot holes and drill into position. Hold the staple against the door frame, level with the bolt. Draw around it with your pencil. Now you need to chisel out a shallow recess for the bolt holder. Make a series of deep cuts along your pencil outline.  Remove the wood.  Check the fit of the bolt holder in the recess. Mark the position of the screw holes. Attach a narrow bit to the drill and drill some pilot holes, then fit a screw head bit and drill the staple into the recess.
